title: Coronation Street spoilers: Bethany confession ahead of death scenes
text:
Bethany Platt (Lucy Fallon) is about to throw the cat majorly among the pigeons when she admits that she is falling in love with Daniel Osbourne (Rob Mallard) in Coronation Street – while he is preparing to say a final and agonising goodbye to his dying wife Sinead Tinker (Katie McGlynn).

Daniel and Bethany shared a moment not long ago when he encouraged her to write an article based on her sexual abuse ordeal and she was the person he turned to when the atmosphere became too much after Sinead learned her cancer was terminal.

With Sinead only having weeks to live, she and Daniel are struggling with the reality that she will soon be gone. Meanwhile, Bethany is distracting herself and asks James Bailey (Nathan Graham) about the politics of being a professional footballer, believing it will make for a good article.

However, her writing takes a different course when she struggles with writing a short story for her course, prompting Brian Packham (Peter Gunn) to step in and help her. As Bethany shows the result to James, he is impressed but he soon realises that it is actually a story about her own experiences and it contains an admission that she is in love with Daniel.

Bethany swears James to secrecy – and Daniel and Sinead have much bigger problems to deal with as Sinead becomes more and more ill, telling Beth (Lisa George) that she is finding even everyday tasks almost impossible.

Knowing that time is running out and that Sinead won’t be alive to see Christmas, Kirk Sutherland (Andrew Whyment) gets the family together and they make plans to celebrate Christmas early so that she can join in the festivities.

But as Daniel continues to struggle with losing Sinead, will he end up seeking solace with Bethany – and will her story come back to haunt her and cast an even darker shadow over Sinead’s already devastating situation?

One to watch: Friday 18th October at 8:30pm on ITV.
